revisionDesc.change: Replace internal notes with external notes
updated TEI header to follow new encoding of respStmt within titlStmt; moved notes to external notes file and replaced with ptr encoding; removed empty opener elements
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Correct notes, add date note. Remove smart quotes and smart apostrophes.
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
we are all as well as usual and have got one of the old fashion snow storms such as we used to have when i was young it is awfull awful and looks as if we should should remain a while on prospect park but i think we have got enoughf enough to eat to stand through it if it dont don't last too long thank god and good sons) poor mrs grayson i felt real sad to hear of her death poor woman she must have been tortured to death probably a happy exchange) i have had a long letter from mr heyde the principle part and the most interesting was about a rabbit that had made up his winter quarters in his woodhouse he spoke of your sending han some gloves and 5 do dollars and walt was a good fellow i suppose you will take it as a great compliment) and han was very ill natured and he had his place
nearly paid for but he sighed for other lands so much for mr heyde

i dont don't think george can come up to day he was up yesterday i roasted him a nice peice piece of mutton so if it stormed and he had it in a little tub he brings up and he left it on the back stoop a few minutes when he went down and some dog got it and went off with it all he wouldent wouldn't take any more so he will have to go out and get his dinner there dont don't seem to be any place without going down town to get any thing well walt i received your letter yesterday with the 5 dollar and paper and envelopes) emma price was here last week she had been to mrs wells the night before to a party and she had the headach headache and felt bad i told her if she d she'd wait till the teakettle tea kettle boiled i would make her some tea so she took off her hat and i fried her a fresh egg and bread and butter before she was half done she said she felt better helen is learning drawing goes every day her mother inhales something paper dipped in some kind of liquid and burned and she inhales the smoke that helps her very quikquick off those bad spelsspells

postscript.p: Jeffy makes my fire when it is very cold he has nervous spells sometimes and is quite moody write to him walt when you can
